content.description:
Sit start in the "cave" with both hands left of the arete on crimps but with big feet. (There is also a really small crimp just right of the arete proper that I normally use because I feel it puts my body in position better.) Pull off the ground to match on the large slopey shelf. From here power up the arete using holds on either side of the arete. To obvious top out holds on the right side of the arete. 

  Foot work and sequence is key to sending this route. The kemple guide has it listed as only climbing the left side of the arete, however that is very contrived and making use of both sides of the arete flows better and still sustains the grade of V6.
content.location:
This problem is situated just right and back of the Pound Crack Boulder. If you stand at The Blot and turn around you will see this problem, looks intense. 

  On the map on the Pound main page this is located on the "Smoke and Mirrors Boulder" (If you couldnt guess...)

content.description:
The sit start is the crux. Pull off the ground using an awkward large block sidepull with your left hand and right hand on a weird crimp. Pull up and rock onto the ledge/shelf, then make generic moves to the top out. 

  This route was showed to me by a friend a few years ago and I don't know the ascent history, my friend never did it he just thought something could go up it. I did it and it isn't anything special but it is something to do when you have done all the classic at the grade.
content.location: On the Smoke and Mirrors Boulder this is on the side that faces away from the heart of the pound. It starts with awkward holds below a shelf which you mantle onto and top out straight up.

content.description: At the present moment there is only one problem on this boulder but there is room for three or four more. The one route there is a super classic and I would suggest it to everyone. Although it is not tall the route that is established and the ones that are possible are hard!
